title: Great Plains 2SNT30 Solid Stand no-till grain drill at auction | bidding closes May 9 2018

tasks.task: Planting seeds in a cornfield
subtasks: Walking through a cornfield
Filling a seed planter with corn seeds
Adjusting the seed planter to correct depth
Inserting the seed planter into the soil
Pressing the seed into the ground

tasks.task: Driving a combine through cornfields
subtasks: Operating the combine steering wheel
Engaging the combine's harvesting mechanism
Ensuring the combine's baskets are properly positioned
Monitoring grain flow and adjust settings as needed
Driving the combine through different parts of the field

tasks.task: Loading corn into a truck using a combine
subtasks: Positioning the combine feeder gate
Connecting the combine's auger to the truck's hopper
Initiating grain discharge from the combine
Monitoring the flow of corn into the truck
Ensuring the truck is not overfilled

tasks.task: Driving a truck to transport corn
subtasks: Loading the truck with corn
Reviewing the truck's condition before driving
Securing the load to prevent spillage
Safely driving the truck to the destination
Unloading the corn from the truck at the desired location

tasks.task: Checking combine hydraulic systems
subtasks: Inspecting hydraulic hoses for leaks
Checking the hydraulic pump's operation
Cleaning any clogged filters or passages
Testing the combine's hydraulic arms for proper function

tasks.task: Repairing combine hydraulic arms
subtasks: Identifying a malfunctioning hydraulic arm
Disconnecting the faulty arm from the hydraulic system
Locating the source of the issue (e.g., broken linkage, damaged cylinder)
Replacing any necessary components
Reconnecting the hydraulic arm and testing its operation

tasks.task: Attaching machinery to a combine
subtasks: Identifying the attachment needed for the task (e.g., wagon, gps sensor)
Lifting the attachment into position
Securing the attachment to the combine
Connecting electrical and hydraulic lines

tasks.task: Performing daily maintenance on a corn combine
subtasks: Cleaning the combine's chassis and exterior
Checking tightenings and adjusting wheels as needed
Lubricating moving parts
Inspecting all safety features and components for functionality

tasks.task: Cleaning combine baskets
subtasks: Accumulating harvested corn in the baskets
Detaching the basket from the combine
Removing any debris or chaff from the basket
Reattaching the cleaned basket to the combine

tasks.task: Applying fertilizer or pesticide to a cornfield
subtasks: Mixing the desired chemical in a spreader tank
Driving the spreader to the cornfield
Ensuring an even spread pattern from the spreader
Adjusting spreader speed and rate as necessary

tasks.task: Walking a cornfield to check for pests or diseases
subtasks: Surveying the corn rows for signs of distress
Identifying areas with unhealthy plants or insect activity
Collecting samples for further analysis if needed
Reporting observations to a supervisor or manager

tasks.task: Operating a tractor to pull a corn planter
subtasks: Attaching the corn planter to the tractor
Checking the implement's attachment points for security
Setting the planter depth according to soil conditions
Beginning to pull the planter through the field

tasks.task: Repairing a broken stalk in a cornfield
subtasks: Identifying a plant with a broken stalk
Assessing the damage severity
Cutting the damaged stalk at ground level
Removing any debris or loose leaves to prevent disease spread

tasks.task: Pruning dead leaves from corn stalks
subtasks: Walking through the cornfield
Locating dead or withered leaves on stalks
Using pruners or a similar tool to remove the dead leaves
Ensuring no damage is done to live tissue

tasks.task: Aligning rows for efficient combine operation
subtasks: Walking the cornfield to identify uneven rows
Marking or noting the rows needing adjustment
Using a cultivator or similar tool to straighten the rows
Replanting if necessary

tasks.task: Operating a sprayer to apply herbicides
subtasks: Mixing the herbicide in the sprayer tank
Guiding the sprayer through the cornfield
Maintaining proper herbicide application settings
Checking for even distribution of the chemical

tasks.task: Cleaning residue from combine baskets
subtasks: Collecting residue from the baskets after harvesting
Removing or breaking down any clumps or debris
Ensuring the baskets drain properly

tasks.task: Filtering grain into containers
subtasks: Harvesting corn and directing it into a container
Using a sifter or other tool to sort grain
Separating unwanted material from the grain
Weighing or measuring the amount of grain collected

tasks.task: Eradicating a broken stalk from a cornfield
subtasks: Locating a broken stalk
Cutting or pulling it out by hand
Disposing of the broken stalk properly
moving through rows, which might not be physical, but parts of it. But maybe as a subtask: walking through a cornfield (SUBTASK).

Then filling a seed planter with corn seeds (SUBTASK). Adjusting the planter depth to ensure correct planting depth (SUBTASK). Inserting the planter into the soil (SUBTASK), then pressing the seed into the ground (another SUBTASK). But perhaps the main task here is Planting seeds in a cornfield (MAINTASK), with subtasks for each step.

Similarly, when operating a combine, there's a main task Driving a combine through cornfields. That's the general action. Underneath, that could involve operating the steering (SUBTASK), engaging the harvesting mechanism (SUBTASK), ensuring baskets are positioned correctly (SUBTASK), monitoring grain flow (SUBTASK), and driving through the field (maybe driving through different parts of it). So break down each component.

tasks.task: For combine maintenance, check hydraulic systems. Subtasks would include inspecting hoses, checking the pump, cleaning filters, testing hydraulic arms. Then if there's a specific task like repairing combine hydraulic arms, that's a separate MAINTASK. Underneath, identifying the problem, disconnecting the arm, locating the issue (like a broken linkage), replacing components, retesting.

Attaching machinery to a combine. The MAINTASK could be Attaching machinery to a combine. Subtasks include identifying the needed attachment, lifting into position, securing the attachment, and connecting lines.
accumulating grain, detaching basket, cleaning debris, and reattaching.
mixing the chemical in the spreader, driving through the field, ensuring even spread, adjusting rate. Pest control would have similar steps.

Operating a tractor with a corn planter would be a MAINTASK. Subtasks might include attaching the planter, checking attachment security, setting depth, and pulling through the field. While doing that, keep an eye on row spacing and depth.
Pruning dead leaves. Subtasks: walking through the field, finding dead leaves, using pruners to remove them, being careful not to damage live tissue.
Operating a sprayer. Subtasks: mixing the herbicide, driving through the field, maintaining the application rate, checking distribution.
identification, cutting at ground level, debris removal.
